info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 17 at 4:53PM MDT by NWS Missoula
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Flathead County through 515 PM MDT... At 453 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Bigfork, or 11 miles southeast of Evergreen, moving north at 55 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half-inch size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Bigfork, Creston, Hungry Horse, Martin City and Coram. This includes the following highways... Highway 2 between mile markers 140 and 146. Highway 83 between mile markers 86 and 90. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
